Thread hh/7

Csaba Hoch Subjects should start with capital letter [hh-conventions, prop, reviewed] <hh/7> <root> (2009-03-07) 
The subject tells everything.

Of course if we have a good reason to use lowercase letters (e.g.
the first word of the subject is the name of a Hm module), it
should be written that way.
Attila Nagy — <hh/26> <↑hh/7> (2009-03-19) 
Uppercase? Somehow deep in my heart I wished this to come out to lowercase...
Csaba Hoch — <hh/28> <↑hh/26> (2009-03-20) 
Just like the git commit messages. For me it's much more natural to
start the subject with an uppercase letter -- that's the start of a
new thought. But I definitely don't want to finish the subject with a
period :D

Actually, it's interesting for me that you wanted a capital letter and
a period for commit messages and you don't want either of those for
subjects. Subjects and commit messages are kinda similar things to me.
Attila Nagy — <hh/40> <↑hh/28> (2009-03-23) 
> Subjects and commit messages are kinda similar things to me.

Not for me. I think what makes these two things different in my
opinion is that a comment message states what you've _done_, therefore
it has to contain a verb and a subject, which make a complete
sentence. With subjects, you just state what will you be talking
about: very often, this is a noun phrase, with no verb, hence not a
complete sentence. Which means I don't feel the capitalization and
period right for them.
Csaba Hoch — <hh/41> <↑hh/40> (2009-03-23) 
[close]

OK.

But not anymore. I don't know what changed in me, maybe I just got
used to it over time.
